revised_title: The Toxic Action of Albumose from Abrus precatorius Seeds
tldr: The author investigates the toxic action of albumose extracted from Abrus precatorius seeds and finds that it causes similar symptoms to those produced by the globulin, including local oedema, inflammation, and rapid breathing. The study also reveals that the poisonous activity of the albumose is destroyed by heating the solution to 75-80°C.
